page.title: 04THE ROSEBERYS (cont)
page.content: Part of Hannah's dowry was{Mentmore {Towers}in Buckinghamshire.However, after only twelve years of marriage Hannah died of typhoid at Dalmeny. Archibald, the 5th Earl, owned three Derby winners, was wealthy,eloquent and popular so he seemed a natural successor to{Gladstone.}However, his administration was shortlived and unremarkable.His only significant act was the introduction of death duties. Ironically this tax would cause the Roseberys to lose Mentmore almost a century later.The 5th Earl died in 1928 leaving as his legacy seven houses, a fabulous art collection, a large collection of{Napoleon memorabilia and a definitive biography of Napoleon. (next page)
